p: Phenolic compounds, as a major group of phytochemicals, have great importance owing to their antioxidant activity. The essential oil C. zeylanicum had a TPC of 106.19 ± 0.63 mg GAE/g dried essential oil. A TPC of 0.91 [ 23], 48.90 [ 24], 53.74 [ 25], and 912 mg GAE/g [ 26] was reported for C. zeylanicum essential oil. These controversial results suggest that the composition and quality of essential oils from plant sources are strongly influenced by the age and variety of the plant, geographical conditions, drying methods, and the extraction procedures used to isolate the essential oils [ 27].
